physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang, It features phoenixes interspersed amongst lotus blooms and a variety of tendrils. The design is set against a plain black background, and the patterns are highlighted in white outline. There is a signature on the bottom-left of the batik kain panjang.
sgcool_label_text: Phoenixes interspersed among lotus blooms and a variety of tendrils decorate this kain panjang.  Set against a plain black ground, the design is enhanced by the use of white dots to outline the motifs.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Hendromartono Batik Art” Unique Pekalongan, Ind”.
subject_terms_2: Batik Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Motifs
